thread.title: Couple caught joining the 'mile high' club mocked over loudspeaker
thread.title_full: Couple caught joining the 'mile high' club mocked over loudspeaker

title: Couple caught joining the 'mile high' club mocked over loudspeaker
text:
Couple caught joining the 'mile high' club mocked over loudspeaker Last updated 13:29, September 10 2015 Peter Braig 
A couple were left red-faced after a Norwegian Air Shuttle flight attendant publicly shamed them. 
A couple were left red-faced after a Norwegian Air Shuttle flight attendant publicly shamed them for reportedly joining the 'mile-high' club in the plane's toilet. 
According to reports in the The Daily Mail , a cabin crew member used the aircraft's loudspeaker to wish the couple a "'best wishes of happy reproduction" during the two-hour flight from Paris to Stockholm. 
READ MORE: 
*New app aims to connect lonely travellers 
A fellow passenger on flight DY4314 told The Local , the plane erupted into cheers and laughter when they learned what two of their fellow travellers had been doing. 
"He said something like "We'd like to send our best wishes of happy reproduction to the couple that ventured into the toilet earlier on. 
"People around the plane started cheering and laughing and there was a lot of gossiping about who it could have been." the woman said. 
A spokesperson for Norwegian is reported to have told MailOnline Travel: "We can confirm there was an incident on board a recent flight from Paris to Stockholm involving two passengers. 
"Whilst we appreciate that Paris is the city of love, we expect passengers to refrain from this type of behaviour on board."
